posts.name: Weston Gardner
Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: Can you send the log that you were attempting to use to run replay? It looks like you added a debug print, so I’m particularly interested in whatever log file was indicated by the LOGPATH print.

posts.name: Weston Gardner
posts.cooked:
The debug message was to confirm findReplayLog got the correct log. The directory was logs\FRC_20250118_233012_sim.wpilog . In the logs folder there are two files both seem to be in text encoding or binary and have a suffix of .wpilog. One was created before the replay sim with all log data, and another ending in _sim that seems to contain only timestamp data, appeared after running the replay sim. Here are pictures of both:

log ending with _sim: image 1640×633 8.93 KB log not ending with _sim: image 1584×673 137 KB

image 1640×633 8.93 KB

image 1640×633 8.93 KB

image 1584×673 137 KB

image 1584×673 137 KB

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: It looks like that log file was produced by WPILib’s data logger and not AdvantageKit. Are you using the DataLogManager class anywhere in your code (including other files) or calling DriverStation.startDataLog ? If not, you might also look for any classes imported from the edu.wpi.first.util.datalog package.

posts.name: Weston Gardner
Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: OK, that would be consistent with this issue. You can just remove the three lines under // data logs . AdvantageKit will produce its own log file (that’s what the WPILOGWriter class is doing) which includes Driver Station data. Note that the default setup only produces log files on the real robot; you’ll have to add Logger.addDataReceiver(new WPILOGWriter()) to the SIM case in the Robot constructor if you want to produce log files in sim too.

posts.name: Weston Gardner
posts.cooked: That worked, Thank you so much!
